intro: Critonia campechensis, commonly known as the Mexican firebush, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and Mexico. It is characterized by its bright red or orange tubular flowers that bloom in spring and summer. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. Critonia campechensis is adapted to full sun and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
